page.title: 09LIMERIGG RELIGION 5
page.content: In 1958 the priest moved to the neighbouring village of Slamannan. The church at Barnsmuir was now getting old and was far away from where the majority of the Catholic Community was living. Eventually they were able to buy a piece of land situated in the village of Slamannan and on 6th June,1960,the hopes of the congregation were at last realised. The new church was consecrated by His Eminence, Cardinal Gordon Joseph Gray. The Roman Catholic members of Limerigg now travel to Slamannan for their place of worship. The old Chapel House at Barnsmuir is still standing and has been transformed into a private house but there are now no visible remains of "St. Mary's".
